Package Calculator

Class CalculatorSimple

java.lang.Object
Calculator.CalculatorSimple
All Implemented Interfaces:
PostFixContract
public class CalculatorSimple
extends java.lang.Object
implements PostFixContract
Represents a postfix calculator.

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    stacks.ArrayStack stack
    CalculatorSimple's stack where operations and numbers ate stored.

  • Method Details

    • isWellFormated

      public boolean isWellFormated​(java.lang.String s)
      Checks if a String is well formated to be operated. If the string is well formed returns true otherwise returns false.
      Specified by:
      isWellFormated in interface PostFixContract
      Parameters:
      s - String to check.
      Returns:
      true if the String is well formed otherwise returns false.

    • stringToStack

      public void stringToStack​(java.lang.String s) throws SyntaxException
      Returns a stack represenation of a String. this method should use isWellFormated method. Each caracter in the String is an element of the stack.
      Specified by:
      stringToStack in interface PostFixContract
      Parameters:
      s - String to be passed to the stack.
      Throws:
      SyntaxException - if the String is not well formed.

    • calculateResult

      public float calculateResult​(float first, float second, java.lang.Character operation) throws OperationException
      Gets the result of an operation between 2 elements. The supported operations are '+' '-' '*' '/'.
      Specified by:
      calculateResult in interface PostFixContract
      Parameters:
      first - number to be operated.
      second - number to be operated.
      operation - operation to do.
      Returns:
      the the calculation.
      Throws:
      OperationException - if there is an invalid Operation.

    • calculateExpression

      public float calculateExpression​(java.lang.String s) throws SyntaxException, exceptions.EmptyException, OperationException
      Calculates final result of an expression passed as an argument. This string argument must be well formed, it has to follow the post fixed calculation method, Ex: ("1 3 + 6 * 9 /").
      Specified by:
      calculateExpression in interface PostFixContract
      Parameters:
      s - the String with the expression to be calculated.
      Returns:
      the final result of the expression passed as argument.
      Throws:
      SyntaxException - if the string syntax is incorrect.
      exceptions.EmptyException - id the stack is empty.
      OperationException - if there is an invalid Operation.
